metadata.Title: CVE-2022-23547 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.Description:
PJSIP is a free and open source multimedia communication library written inC language implementing standard based protocols such as SIP, SDP, RTP,STUN, TURN, and ICE. This issue is similar to GHSA-9pfh-r8x4-w26w. Possiblebuffer overread when parsing a certain STUN message. The vulnerabilityaffects applications that uses STUN including PJNATH and PJSUA-LIB. Thepatch is available as commit in the master branch.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-23547` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

jami - 20230206.0~ds2-1.3
jami-daemon - 20230206.0~ds2-1.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ring package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '20230206.0~ds2-1.3').
